Landmarks: Campo is the monument of the southern terminus
Description: This Paths of the trail is the most southern; here you go through dessert You are in the very southern part and in summer this can be very hot
Description_new: This southernmost trail section traverses desert terrain requiring hydration due to high daytime temperatures and cold nights. You'll walk near Sheephead Mountain; Wooden Hill; and through Sawtooth Mountains wilderness. The route includes Anza-Borrego Desert State Park; established in 1932 and named after explorer Juan Bautista de Anza ("borrego" means sheep). The park spans 237;120 hectares and features remarkable spring blooms.

Landmarks: Combs Peak is the highest point of the isolated Bucksnort Mountain mini-range in northern San Diego County.
Description: You will pass through rugged desert terrain featuring occasional oases and challenging climbs in this segment You will walk through Jacinto Wildernes   You need to cross Mission Creek several times
Description_new: Pass through rugged desert with occasional oases and challenging climbs. Beyond Warner Springs; you'll skirt Combs Peak with chaparral vegetation. Traverse San Jacinto Wilderness and approach Suicide Rock; offering mountain views without major climbing. A free permit is required for Suicide Rock. Continue to Sand to Snow National Monument with iconic red mountains backed by snow-covered peaks; then ascend Onyx Peak in the San Bernardino Mountains.

Landmarks: Big Bear Lake is Southern California's four-season mountain lake escape and one of the world's rare Sky Island Forests
Description: On this part of the Trail yo can see Mt Baden Powell who is the founder of scouts. The first groups of scouts were formed in 1907 on the basis og his book Aids for Scouting You walk on the egde of Big Bear City
Description_new: Walk near Big Bear Lake; the jewel of San Bernardino National Forest covering 3;333.87 km_. The forest was used for filming "Daniel Boone" (1936) and "Paint Your Wagon" (1969). Cross Interstate 15 at approximately 1;436 meters elevation; passing Table Mountain and Mount San Antonio. Nearby Vasquez Rock features striking formations created by millions of years of erosion and has been a popular filming location.

Landmarks: Mount Baden Powell is the 4th highest peak in San Gabriel Range with 853 meters over the surrounding terrain.
Description: You go in Angeles National forests On this part of the route you walk in a mixture of hilly terrain and valleys of sand You are both  on the egde of moutains and have some of the trail in the city of Lancaster
Description_new: Trek through Angeles National Forest; an urban wilderness providing solitude and unique recreation opportunities. Climb Mt. Baden-Powell; named after the founder of scouts and a classic San Gabriel peak-bagging hike. Experience hilly terrain and sand valleys; passing through Agua Dulce with its rolling hills and Vasquez Rocks. The trail traverses Lancaster city areas and includes Walker's Pass and 1;781-meter Burnt Peak with expansive views.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Kennedy Meadows
Landmarks: Double Mountain is the highest point in the Tehachapi Mountains of California.
Description: This part of the trail is hilly and you will need to cross several small creeks  You will both walk in hilly terran and forretes
Description_new: Hike through hilly terrain crossing several small creeks. Pass Double Mountain with its twin summits near Tehachapi. Encounter Mojave city; established in 1876 as a Southern Pacific Railroad construction camp and later headquarters for Los Angeles Aqueduct construction. The trail ascends Welden Peak for expansive views; then winds between Piute Peak and Sorrell Peak showcasing diverse vegetation and geological features while skirting Pinyon Mountain.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Forester Pass
Landmarks: Kiawah Wilderness is renowned for its natural beauty and abundant wildlife
Description: You walk in both Owen Peak Wilderness; Kiavah Wildernes and Domeland Wildernes. A part with a lot of protected nature; so in this path the chance for uniqe experince  You will be climbing many meters both up and down. You will be walking through the South Sierra Wilderness and there will be several mountain peaks and peaks around you along the way  You are walking in an area with many mountains. Some of the ones you can see on the trip are: Mount Withney; Mount Langley; Kern Peak; Cirque Peak
Description_new: Cross three wilderness areas - Owens Peak; Kiavah; and Domeland - each with unique landscapes from rugged mountains to intricate rock formations and forests. Navigate South Sierra Wilderness surrounded by dramatic peaks including Rockhouse; Ball Mountain; Bald Mountain; and Olancha Peak. Continue through terrain dominated by Mount Stanford; Mount Williamson; iconic Mount Whitney; Mount Langley; and Cirque Peak before culminating near Muah Mountain.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Sonora Pass
Landmarks: Mount Whitney is the highest summit in the contiguous United States which provides a spectacular highlight
Description: You are in the middel of Inyo National Forrest. Inyo National Forest extends approximately 265 kilometers near the California and Nevada border. It covers about 809.371 hectares mostly on the eastern slope of the Sierra Nevada  You are walking in an area with many mountains and you encounter many altitude differences at the same time there are many larger and smaller lakes
Description_new: Traverse Inyo National Forest; spanning 265 kilometers near the California-Nevada border covering 809;371 hectares on the Sierra Nevada's eastern slope. Pass between Mount Clarence King; Acrodectes Peak; Mount Goddard; and Mount Darwin - a 4;218-meter flat-topped mountain. Navigate diverse landscapes with dramatic altitude changes around Bloody Mountain; Red Slate Mountain; Mount Morgan; and Seven Gables; encountering various lakes near Silver Peak and Mammoth Lakes.

Location: Sierra Nevada & Northern California - Donner Memorial State Park
Landmarks: Mount Ritter is 4008 meter above sealevel and was named by Josiah Whitney chief of California geological survey
Description: You walk in both Ansel Adams Wildernes and the great Yosemite National Park. It was first protected in 1864.Yosemite National Park is best known for its waterfalls but you can find deep valleys and grand meadows as well  As the trail moves northward; it traverses the lush forests of Northern California; with a mix of steep inclines and dense woodland  During this par of the trail You'll cross the border between California and Oregon
Description_new: Experience Ansel Adams Wilderness and Yosemite National Park; established in 1864. View Mount Ritter; Mount Lyell; Mount Dana and Clouds Rest. Continue through Yosemite Wilderness into Hoover Wilderness through dense woodlands and challenging terrain near Tower Peak. Navigate Carson-Iceberg Wilderness with Highland Peak; Whitecliff Peak; Sonora Peak and Leavitt Peak featuring rugged terrain; glacial remnants; dense conifer forests and waterways ideal for high-altitude trekking.

Landmarks: Pyramid Peak is 787 meter above the surrounding terrain
Description: It is a varied terrain with both forest and desert  and you will pass by a lot of large and small lakes  You will walk in Donner Memorial State Park some of the parth. The very large Lake Tahoe is close by  the closest towns to the trail are Tahoe Pines; Homewood and Rubicon Bay
Description_new: Hike near Lake Tahoe through majestic landscapes in the Lake Tahoe Basin Management Unit. Ascend towards Ralston Peak and Pyramid Peak for sweeping views of forests and the lake. The trail weaves through rugged terrain near Granite Chief and Tinker Knob along part of the Tahoe Rim Trail. Nearby towns include Truckee with historical charm and Tahoe City with lakeside scenery; providing important resupply stops.

Landmarks: Love Falls is just a short hike from where the trail crosses Highway 49 traveling east of the quaint village of Sierra City
Description: You walk on the egde opf Sierra city. You need to cross North Yuba River and Haypress Creek. When Crossing North Yba Falls You walk very close to Love Falls  This is a hilly stretch where you also have to cross the Middle Fork Feather River  If You do the hole trail you are in this segment in the middel or half to reach your desination. You need to cross North Fork Feather River and Yellow Creek
Description_new: Cross North Yuba River and Haypress Creek near scenic North Yuba Falls and Love Falls. Sierra City offers civilization before returning to secluded Tahoe National Forest paths. Continue through Plumas National Forest's dense forests; mountainous vistas and remote wilderness. The trail passes Quincy for resupply; then through Bucks Lake Wilderness near Bald Eagle Mountain; Ben Lomond; and Snow Mountain; crossing Highway 70 multiple times with views of Castle Rocks and Eagle Rocks.

Landmarks: Lassen Peak is lava dome volcano in Lassen Volcanic National Park in Northern California.
Description: You will here walk in Lassen Volcanic National Park. You walk between different Mountans and Peaks. This is a parth with various elevation  You will cross Pit River and come close to Burney Falls; which is 25 meter and defenitly a visit worth. Here You can find campsites and Rental Cabins
Description_new: Navigate diverse volcanic landscapes in Lassen Volcanic National Park featuring Lassen Peak; one of the world's largest plug dome volcanoes; plus Brokeoff Mountain and Mount Harkness. Enjoy mixed forests; streams and meadows with abundant wildlife. Cross Pit River near 25-meter Burney Falls (worth visiting); which offers campsites and rental cabins. Experience rolling hills; dense forests and expansive meadows with views of Burney Mountain and convenient resupply opportunities.

Landmarks: Stump Creek Butte is 1248 meters above sealevel
Description: You'll walk in Shasta-Trinity National Forrest and Lassen National Forrest. If the water level is high You need to cross several small creeks and streams  You'll walk through Castle Crags Wilderness and Castle Crags State Park. You will cross Burstarse Creek; Indidan Creek and Popcorn Spring during the trail  You will be able to see several peaks on this parth including: Russian Peak; Deadman Peak; Eagle Peak; Sugar Hill; Craggy Peak; Cory Peak and Mount Eddy
Description_new: Traverse rugged mountainous terrain through Shasta-Trinity and Lassen National Forests marked by Grizzly Peak; Brushy Butte; and Tamarack Mountain. Cross Castle Crags Wilderness; Castle Crags State Park; and streams including Burstarse Creek; Indian Creek; and Popcorn Spring. The Sacramento River crossing occurs near Dunsmuir. View Russian Peak; Deadman Peak; Eagle Peak; Sugar Hill; Craggy Peak; Cory Peak; and Mount Eddy while experiencing diverse alpine forests and high mountain meadows.

Landmarks: Big Ridge with the elevation of 2141meters is one of the 18 peaks you climb during PCT
Description: You will walk in Klamath National forres and Marble Mountain Wilderness. You climpe Big Ridge with the elevation of 2141meters  On this stretch you will pass through Seaid Wally and up over Kangaroo Mountain; Black Mountain and Observation Peak among others. A stretch with many meters of elevation gain
Description_new: Journey through Klamath National Forest and Marble Mountain Wilderness with its vast rugged terrain. Climb Big Ridge (2;141 meters) and tackle significant elevation gains over Seiad Valley; Kangaroo Mountain; Black Mountain; and Observation Peak. The trail winds through remote areas between these mountains; providing immersive wilderness experiences combining natural beauty and solitude. Seiad Valley along the Klamath River serves as a notable resupply checkpoint.

Landmarks: Sonora Peak is located on the boundary between Alpine and Mono counties it is 3494 meters above sealevel
Description: During this par of the trail You'll cross the border between California and Oregon  You will walk in The Sky Lakes Wilderness straddles southern Oregon's Cascade Range from Crater Lake National Park southward to Oregon Route 140. It is approximately 9.7 kmwide and 43 km long. Thelevations ranging from 1.200 m in the canyon of the Middle Fork of the Rogue River to 2.894 m at the top of Mount McLoughlin is the highest peak in southern Oregon  You will walk close by Crater Lake that is surrounded by several high points. This including Garfield Peak; Llao Rock and Grouse Hill
Description_new: Cross from California into Oregon through Sky Lakes Wilderness (9.7km wide; 43km long) with elevations from 1;200m to 2;894m at Mount McLoughlin; southern Oregon's highest peak. Visit Crater Lake National Park; created when a violent eruption collapsed a tall peak 7;700 years ago. As America's deepest and one of its purest lakes; it's surrounded by Garfield Peak; Llao Rock; and Grouse Hill.

Landmarks: Cowhorn Mountain the summit spire that led to its name collapsed in a storm in 1911
Description: On this part You walk in hilly terrain and pass Cowhorn Mountain which is  2336 meters high  In this Segment You will walk through Willamette National Forrest and Deschutes National Forrest and pass several lakes
Description_new: Hike hilly terrain past 2;336-meter Cowhorn Mountain through Willamette and Deschutes National Forests and several lakes. The path offers expansive views; lush forests and Diamond Peak's rugged slopes. Continue through Oregon's volcanic landscape passing the iconic Three Sisters volcanoes - North; Middle; and South Sister - with The Husband peak opposite. Traverse diverse ecosystems including alpine forests; lava fields; and wildflower meadows in Three Sisters Wilderness.

Landmarks: Mount Jefferson is a vulcano the last eruptive about 15000 years ago.
Description: On this part of the trail You walk past tree vulcanos that is caled The Tree Sisters. When You have Middel Sister and South sister on one side You will have the moutan The husband on the other side of you  On this part of the trial You will wlak in the National Park of Mount Hood  Mount Hood is also known as Wy'east. It is an active stratovolcano. The summit elavation is 3.429 meter and has glaciers all year
Description_new: Pass Mount Jefferson Wilderness into Mount Washington Wilderness with its distinctive spire-like volcanic peak. Experience solitude through steep rocky ascents and serene forest walks with panoramic Cascade Range vistas. Continue past Olallie Butte overlooking numerous lakes and forests near Mount Jefferson. Approach Mount Hood (Wy'east); an active 3;429-meter stratovolcano with year-round glaciers - Oregon's highest peak; visible from Portland and surrounded by protected wilderness.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Pasayten Wilderness
Landmarks: Brigde of the Gods is 565 meters long and spans the Columbia River between Cascade Locks in Oregon and Washington state
Description: On this part You'll cross the Columbia River and also the border between Oregon and Washinton. On both sides You walk in forrest. This could be a good place to stock up as you come right through the town of Casade Locks which is the biggest city You will go through  Now You are walkning in Gifford Pinoct National Forrest. It contains over 1.3 milion acers of green forests soaring mountains; dewy meadows; and rapid streams
Description_new: Cross Columbia River between Oregon and Washington through Cascade Locks city - ideal for resupply. Enter Gifford Pinchot National Forest containing over 1.3 million acres of forests; mountains; meadows; and streams. Continue through Indian Heaven Wilderness with old-growth forests; alpine lakes; and vibrant wildflower meadows. Pass Sawtooth Mountain; Bird Mountain; and Lemel Rock; each providing unique vistas and wildlife viewing opportunities. The area displays striking autumn foliage.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Windy Pass
Landmarks: Mount Adams is also known by some Native American tribes as Pahto or Klickitat and is an active stratovolcano
Description: On this part You walk through the Mount Adams Wildersness; where the trail take you close to the mountan and the glacier  Mount Rainier is the most glaciated peak in the contiguous U.S.A.; spawning five major rivers. You will see subalpine wildflower meadows ring the icy volcano while ancient forest cloaks Mount Rainiers lower slopes You are walking in Norse Peak Wildernes
Description_new: Traverse Mount Adams Wilderness near the mountain and glacier; then Goat Rock Wilderness near 2;494-meter Gilbert Peak - an eroded extinct stratovolcano with Meade and Conrad Glaciers. Continue through William O. Douglas and Norse Peak Wilderness areas near Mount Rainier; America's most glaciated peak. View subalpine wildflower meadows and ancient forests while passing Norse Peak; Crown Point; and Pigtail Peak. Visit Kelly Butte Lookout (1;640m) and Snoqualmie Pass (919m).

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Manning Park (Canada)
Landmarks: Chimney Rock is 22355 meter above sealevel and is known for the two spikes
Description: You go thrugh Snoqualmie is best known as the home of Snoqualmie Falls- a breathtaking waterfall cascading 81.6 meter over granite cliffs. Snoqualmie Falls is the second most visited natural landmark in Washington after Mount Rainier. It is more than twice as high as Niagara Falls!  You are walking in Alpine Lake Wildernes
Description_new: Hike through Snoqualmie area; home to Snoqualmie Falls - an 81.6-meter waterfall over granite cliffs and Washington's second most visited natural landmark after Mount Rainier. Navigate Alpine Lakes Wilderness with deep valleys; craggy peaks and numerous lakes. Continue through Henry M. Jackson Wilderness (41;803ha); created in 1984 and named after the Senator instrumental in designating Washington's wilderness areas. Pass near 2;260-meter Mount David in Glacier Peak Wilderness.

Location: Northern Washington & Canada Border - Hope - British Columbia
Landmarks: Glacier Peak is a volcano formed during the Pleistocene epoch about one million years ago
Description: You are walking in the north and meeting several glaciers including Kennedy Peak and Glacier Peak  In theese segments the trail cover some of the most challenging and rewarding terrain of the PCT; culminating in the alpine glory of the North Cascades  This is the most northly part of the trail
Description_new: Encounter Kennedy Peak and 3;213-meter Glacier Peak - Washington's fourth highest - featuring White Chuck; Kennedy; and Suiattle glaciers. Explore Glacier Peak Wilderness (229;075ha); established 1964; with steep terrain; old-growth forests; and alpine lakes. Pass near Bonanza Peak; Mount Fernow; and Lake Chelan National Recreation Area. View 2;393-meter Mount Winthrop in Okanogan County. Reach the Northern Terminus at the US-Canada border near Manning Park; marked by a wooden monument.
